title: Thunderbird password saving
content:
My Gmail account opens fine in Chrome. Thunderbird can't get to it; it says my password is incorrect. I have tried it enough times to know I've not typed them all incorrectly.

I'm baffled, all help gratefully received.
creator: roy.gardiner.uk

title: Thb borró todas las bandejas de entrada al abrirlo
content: Buenos días, tengo 8 cuentas de correo IMAP. Al abrir Thunderbird, se han ido borrando todos los mensajes de la bandeja de entrada de todas las cuentas, durante unos segundos, hasta quedar vacías todas esas carpetas. Afortunadamente, los mensajes borrados estaban en la papelera de cada cuenta IMAP. Al suceder esto, he cerrado Thb y he ido al disco de almacenamiento de los correos, y figuraba temopalmente inaccesible, sin autorización de acceso. Pasados unos minutos, he podido acceder al disco, y también he podido restaurar manualmente todas las bandejas de entrada ¿Qué ha podido suceder? Gracias!
creator: polarqui

title: Unable to send emails - they get timed out
creator: rsjv58

title: "Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username, or password." When signing into Thunderbird for the first time on Linux Mint
content:
When trying to use Thunderbird for the first time after a fresh install of Linux Mint (latest version, Cinnamon 21.3 Virginia if that helps), I try to sign into my gmail but the error in the subject shows up. When going into advanced config, I get the error "Could not connect to mail server imap.gmail.com; connection refused." I have tried a lot of fixes on the internet, but with no success (things like allowing the ports necessary through firewall, using an app password, etc.). Oddly enough, I have also tried this with ubuntu23.10.1 and windows 11, but with the same result (which leads me to believe this is an issue with the app itself or just me being dumb). My configs are, as follows: Incoming Server: Protocol: IMAP Hostname: imap.gmail.com Port: 993 Connection Security: SSL/TLS Authentication method: OAuth2 Username: [my email]@gmail.com

Outgoing Server: Hostname: smtp.gmail.com Port: 465 Connection Security: SSL/TLS Authentication Method: OAuth2 Username:[my email]@gmail.com

Help?
creator: liam2010b1

title: Threads unread emails.
content: Having threads is not very helpful with unread items within that thread. I don't think the developers thought this through. If any one email in a thread was not read it should show the the thread in bold just as emails. Is this a bug or a feature? How can I change that?

title: Unabeto send emails , I ghet an ERROR message.
content:

An error occurred while sending mail: Outgoing server (SMTP) error. The server responded: csmtp6-prd-nl1-vmo.edge.unified.services csmtp6-prd-nl1-vmo.edge.unified.services Virgin Media has blocked your connecting IP 86.19.75.0 Too many bad emails have been sent. Visit https://netreport.virginmedia.com/netreport Section: Email Sending Errors to request delisting.

Can you help me ?

I can receive emails but unable to send them.

title: start thread reply at top of thread
content:
I want to start a reply at the top of the thread not the bottom. All help that I have found refers me to "settings - composition - automatic quote" I have no such thing as automatic quote (V15.7.0) in my settings.

How do I change the location of my reply from bottom of thread to the top?
creator: rjk.dsp

title: Using Thunderbird on Godaddy Email Outlook will not bring over all folders
content:
Godaddy a while back switched to Outlook365 I have installed Thunderbird and created an account and added the OWL for Exchange add-on So it has (as many have said) brought over the original inbox emails But the extra folders I have in Outlook from Godaddy did not migrate I see a lot of chat about IMAP and the server type in server setting says IMAP I have seem chat about adding subscribe folders but its never clear or a different version So I need some pointers on what needs done in outlook and what needs done in thunderbird

Thanks
creator: ddahlman

title: Thunderbird Completely Stopped Working
content:
Shortly after a recent microsoft update, Thunderbird stopped working entirely. No downloads from gmail, manually or automatically, I can't send emails either and I get an endless message that it's trying to copy the outgoing email to the Sent folder (I think), but it never actually does it, and the message never goes out.

I've gone through a bunch of the suggested fixes from various forums and checked the settings. The only one that was different from the recommended settings was hardware acceleration, which I turned off.

I'm at a loss. It won't even download manually when I hit the button for "Get Messages."

Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks
creator: steve.frandzel

title: Send message failed -- no other error
content: I have 4 different gmail accounts that I use thunderbird to manage, along with local folders. Starting today, I cannot send messages. I get a dialog box with no error codes, underneath is another dialog box showing send progress with the eternal circle. Have rebooted, made sure each account has a unique SMTP server description. Worked fine until today. No updates that I know of.
creator: ldscottconsultingllc
